body.p: Publications that provide an "overview" of DITA for people just getting into it can be invaluable. Unlike a commercial product that has an active Marketing department defining and defending its borders, DITA consists of a set of related specifications, projects, and supporting commercial poroducts:

li.p: DITA is a formal XML language specification developed and maintained by OASIS.
DITA is a set of ready-to-use XML topic types, map types, and domain vocabularies that accompany the XML language specification. This is often called OOTB DITA (out-of-the-box DITA).
DITA is a powerful, extensible framework that allows you to constrain, enhance, or replace the OOTB topics, maps, or domains. DITA generally calls these extensions "specializations."

DITA is a collection of open-source and commercial XML processsing suites. Perhaps the most well-known of these processing suites is the open-source project named the DITA Open Toolkit. DITA-OT and the other processing suites are developed independently from any OASIS specification work.

DITA is supported by a robust collection of authoring, processing, and content management tools. As long as a tool complies to the OASIS DITA standard, you can use it with confidence that your content is not getting trapped in some proprietary markup or file format.

DITA is also the intersection of these resoirces and tools. When people at a company say that they are "working in DITA," they are talking about some unique combination of OOTB DITA resources, commercial tools, and customizations. No two implementationsof DITA are indentical.
